question: Question_06_(d)
statement:
What points in the plane would you plot to produce a frequency-amplitude
plot for the function in
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2010/Question_06_(a)}{part
(a)}?
sols:
From
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2010/Question_06_(a)}{part
(a)}, we figured out that $c_{n} = -\frac{1}{2\pi in}$. The modulus of
this complex number, $\left | c_n \right |$, is the amplitude of
oscillation with frequency $\omega _n=n$ since L is equal to 1. We have
that

\begin{align*}\left| c_n \right|= \left| -\frac{1}{2\pi in} \right|= \frac1{2\pi n} \left|\frac{-1}{i}\right| = \frac{1}{2\pi n}\end{align*}

for $n\neq 0$. When $n = 0$, the amplitude is equal to
$\left| c_0 \right|$ which is $c_{0} = \frac{1}{2}$ from
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2010/Question_06_(a)}{part
(a)}. Therefore the points for a frequency amplitude plot are
$\displaystyle (n,|c_n|)$ given by

\begin{align*}
(0,&1/2)\\
(1,&1/2\pi)\\
(2,&1/4\pi)\\
&\vdots\\
(n,&1/2n\pi)\end{align*}
